title: Gaza starvation is real and it is happening now, UN World Food Programme says – Middle East crisis live
summary: Cindy McCain discussed with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu the possibility of increasing food supplies into Gaza. Her conversation reflects ongoing humanitarian concerns in the region. The discussions aim to alleviate the dire situation faced by civilians in the strip.

title: Neil Young confronts Donald Trump in new song Big Crime: ‘Don’t want soldiers on the streets’
summary: A veteran rocker sharply criticizes the US administration by labeling it as fascistic in a song recorded during a sound check in Chicago. The musician's comments reflect deep political sentiments and concerns. The performance highlights ongoing tensions around governance and civil rights in the country.

title: Mourinho sacked by Fenerbahce, Simons to join Spurs and more: football news – live
summary: Join our writers for real-time updates as we approach an exciting weekend in the top flight. Stay informed with the latest news and developments. Don't miss out on the action!

title: Immediate closure of asylum hotels could lead to migrants ‘living destitute in the streets’, says minister – UK politics live
summary: Stephen Kinnock has cautioned that a "disorderly discharge" from current circumstances could result in even more severe consequences than the existing situation. He emphasizes the importance of careful management to avoid potential chaos. Kinnock's warning highlights the risks associated with abrupt changes.

title: Zelenskyy calls for more pressure on Russia so ‘murderers do not feel impunity’ after Thursday’s Kyiv strikes – Europe live
summary: EU defense ministers are set to meet to address mounting pressure on Russia amid ongoing tensions. Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas has accused President Vladimir Putin of undermining peace initiatives. The discussions will focus on strategies to respond to Russia's actions and bolster European security.
